projects.projectDescription: The original version of this very page! While the original version had almost no JavaScript, the live version in front of you is now a single-page app.
projects.whatLearned: This project was to show understanding of HTML (including semantic markup) and CSS.

projects.projectDescription: This is a digital version of the card game Memory. Try matching two cards together!
projects.whatLearned: This project was to show understanding of JavaScript and how it can be used to manipulate the DOM, but was before learning OOP.

projects.projectDescription: This is a clone of the classic frogger arcade game, with a 3rd grade twist.
projects.whatLearned: This project was to show understanding of objects and classes in JavaScript to create sprites on Canvas.

projects.projectDescription: Create a number of tests for an RSS reader (provided by Udacity).
I was provided with a static site, and asked to make it responsive, accessible, and create a ServiceWorker for data caching and offline use.
projects.whatLearned: This project was to prove that I could work within the provided app to make it responsive, accessible, and create a ServiceWorker. There was also some CSS work to make the original design less terrible.

companyList.name: Intrida
text: I was hired as a contractor to produce the front-end portion of an ElectronJS app aimed at enterprise-type deployment.
My role included working with the in-house designer and another contractor team in charge of the server and back-end development.
A challenge I faced was the client directed that all development was to be done without outside frameworks or libraries.
I used a Model-View-Controller (MVC) design pattern to create multiple pages with large amounts of functionality, and managing multiple asynchronous calls to the server.

companyList.name: Ratcliff
text: At Ratcliff I worked on design and permitting of hospital projects.
The biggest such project was a complicated new three story project with a complicated phasing scheme to keep the hospital active during construction.
It involved working closely with the contractor using a Integrated Project Delivery (IPD) - lite contract to ensure clean delivery of a good project.
I also worked on three pharmacy update projects for Sutter Health to bring them into compliance with new laws related to clean room environments for compounding medicines

The pharmacy projects involved extensive work with both a pharmacy standards team (developing the standards at the same time as design, resulting in shifting expectations), but also extensively interviewing and reviewing design decisions with the pharmacist in charge to make sure the needs of the hospital were met.

companyList.name: Shah Kawasaki Architects
text: At Shah Kawasaki I worked primarily on public buildings, including fire stations, crime labs, and a renovation of a historic classroom building.
I also wrote from scratch their Revit standards, and implemented them with the staff.

companyList.name: Modulus Consulting
companyList.business: Small/Medium BIM consultancy firm to the AEC industry
companyList.project: Residential, Museum, Commercial, Industrial, and Research
text: As a Building Information Modeling (BIM) consultant, my tasks were extremely varied by client. I would be sent to the clients office to to determine what their needs were, develope a game plan with them, and execute it.
This often required extensively learning and understanding the client's business, to determine how to use BIM to either aid in that or communicate this information to others

This included taking on tasks from developing phased models for presention to their clients, to making models for internal visualization, to assisting in creating their BIM standards for in-house teams.

companyList.name: Degenkolb Engineers
text: As an in-house drafter/modeler, it was my job to help the engineers digitize their design in either 2D or (preferably) 3D
Additionally, I assisted in creating new standards for using our 3D software and troubleshooting stubborn issues.

interpersonal.name: Interpersonal
skillList: Work directly with client representatives spanning many levels of large company/government organizations
Responsible for listening and incorporating user needs
Experience working in teams of all sizes
Experience coordinating diverse teams of engineers
Good writing skills, developed 100+ page feasibility report for client

leed.name: LEED Accredited Professional (LEED AP)
leed.subInfo: Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design
